title: USA TODAY Releases Two New Augmented Reality Interactives for Women’s World Cup
text:
CLOSE

USA TODAY has released two new augmented reality (AR) experiences ahead of the Women’s World Cup tournament, “Meet the Team” and a game-like experience, “Make the Save.”

The “Meet the Team” experience allows users to learn about the individual players on Team USA, set within a virtual soccer field. Users can access information to learn more about each player and see their position highlighted on a virtual field. The interactive also allows users to stay up to date with the US women’s standing in the group stage, their most recent match score, and game schedule.

“We wanted to provide an immersive way to learn more about the US Women’s team throughout the lifecycle of this year’s World Cup,” said Ray Soto, Director of Emerging Technology, USA TODAY. “We have seen how much AR informs and entertains users so it’s a natural fit for brands to want to be a part of these engaging experiences as well. And, keeping consumers engaged throughout the World Cup experience really builds excitement.”

In addition to “Meet the Team,” USA TODAY is launching its first gaming AR interactive, “Make the Save.” Within the game-like experience, users have the opportunity to test their skills blocking penalty kicks by stepping into the shoes of Alyssa Naeher, the U.S. goalkeeper. Naeher shares details related to being the No. 1 goalkeeper for the world’s top-ranked team, her amazing record, and how she describes defending against one of the game’s toughest shots. To create this experience, Naeher was captured using photogrammetry to incorporate a 3D visual similar to USA TODAY’s recent AR interactives including “Oscars AR: The costumes and creators.”

The augmented reality interactives are available in the USA TODAY mobile app, for both iOS and Android users. Please visit "Meet the Team" or "Make the Save" from a mobile device.
